Package edu.uoc.uocoban.controller

Class Game

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.uocoban.controller.Game
public class Game extends Object
Controller class of the game. It is the middleware (or bridge) between the model and view classes.
This class is called from the view classes in order to access/modify the model data. This class controls the logic of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(String fileFolder) throws IOException
      Constructor with argument.
      Parameters:
      fileFolder - Folder name where the configuration/level files are.
      Throws:
      IOException - When there is a problem while retrieving number of levels

  • Method Details

    • setFileFolder

      private void setFileFolder(String fileFolder)
      Setter of the attribute fileFolder.
      Parameters:
      fileFolder - Folder name where the configuration/level files are.

    • getFileFolder

      private String getFileFolder()
      Getter of the attribute fileFolder.
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute fileFolder.

    • getCurrentLevel

      public int getCurrentLevel()
      Getter of the attribute currentLevel.
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute currentLevel that indicates which level the player is playing.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Getter of the attribute "score" (Game score).
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute "score"

    • setScore

      private void setScore(int score)
      Setter of the attribute "score" (Game score).
      Parameters:
      score - New value for the attribute "score"

    • getLives

      public int getLives()
      Returns the number of lives that the player has in the current game.
      Returns:
      Number of lives in the current game.

    • decLives

      public void decLives()
      Decreases the number of lives that the user has in the current game. If lives is 0, then this method does nothing.

    • getRemainingMovements

      public int getRemainingMovements()
      Gets the current remaining movements of the level that the player is playing.
      Returns:
      Remaining movements of the current level.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Gets the Player object which is present in the current level.
      Returns:
      Reference to the Player object in the current level.

    • nextLevel

      public boolean nextLevel() throws LevelException
      Checks if there is a new level to play and loads it.
      If the game is finished, it returns false. Otherwise, it returns true.
      The game score must be updated when a level is finished. The score for a given level is the total amount of remaining movements when finishing the game. Thus, when the player is playing the first level, game's score is zero.
      Returns:
      true if there is a next level, and it has been loaded correctly. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem loading the new level.

    • loadLevel

      private void loadLevel() throws LevelException
      Loads a new level by using the value of the attribute currentLevel.

      The pattern of the filename is: fileFolder+"level" + numberLevel + ".txt".

      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Indicates if the game is finished (true) or not (false).

      The game is finished when the attribute currentLevel is equal to attribute maxLevels.

      Returns:
      true if there are no more levels and therefore the game is finished. Otherwise, false.

    • isLevelCompleted

      public boolean isLevelCompleted()
      Checks if the current level is completed, i.e. all objects from type Destination have a valid Box.
      Returns:
      true if this level is completed, otherwise false.

    • isLevelDeadlocked

      public boolean isLevelDeadlocked()
      Checks if the current level is deadlocked, i.e. the player cannot perform any movements to win the game
      Returns:
      true if this level is deadlocked, otherwise false.

    • hasLostGame

      public boolean hasLostGame()
      Checks if the player has lost the game, i.e. the number of lives is zero
      Returns:
      true if this the player has lost, otherwise false.

    • hasLostLevel

      public boolean hasLostLevel()
      Checks if the player has lost the current level.
      Returns:
      true if the number of remaining movements is 0 and the current level has not been won; otherwise, false.

    • reloadLevel

      public void reloadLevel() throws LevelException
      Reloads the current level, i.e. load the level again.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Restarts the game so that it starts again. Specifically:
      • score is set to 0
      • lives is set to default value (i.e., 3)
      • currentLevel is set to 0

    • getItemMapListIterator

      public Iterator<MapItem> getItemMapListIterator()
      Gets an Iterator of the itemMapList
      Returns:
      Iterator of the itemMapList

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(Direction direction)
      Moves the player in a specific direction. If the player is successfully moved, then the remaining movements of the level must be decreased.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction (i.e., UP, DOWN, lEFT, RIGHT) towards the user is moved to.
